sentence.text: He ushered them to the door .
And , as if she were the therapist and the journalist the patient , Eleanor ushered Valerie from the door .
Celia ushered her to the door .
He returned shortly and ushered them into an airy office , overlooking the Grand Union Canal .
At exactly ten o'clock , the clerk informed them that Mr Hardiman would see them now , and they were ushered into his office .
Langton realized her impatience and ushered them out of the office towards another door , which he opened with a heavy key he took from his pocket .
Jahsaxa ushered Zambia into the room .
I was ushered into a waiting room by a madam and then eventually shown into a bedroom .
She ushered Melissa out of the room into a small entrance hall and indicated a door on the other side .
I was ushered into a high-ceilinged room dark with oak panelling .
The President ushered his party into seats which had been kept vacant in the top bench and then he turned to address the community .
Lotta ushered Gina back to the table , seating herself in Rune 's chair and indicating Gina should join her .
She knew me to be a rogue as soon as she clapped eyes on me and , whilst her father ushered me to a seat , she watched girlishly out of the corner of her eye .
He ushered Ignatius towards a low glass table surrounded by comfortable chairs on the far side of the room .
Alan ushered them down towards the table .
He did not bother to look up when Corbett and Ranulf were ushered in but made a gesture for them to sit on the bench alongside the table while he continued noisily with his meal .
I pretended to be looking at some papers when the door opened and Grace Hinkle ushered in a sophisticated-looking female of about twenty-eight .
McLaren was then ushered in from an adjoining office .
The place was surround by troops as the journalists were ushered in .
As the door opened , Alain ushered in a small dark woman , his hand on her shoulder , and Jenna 's expectations collapsed like a deflated balloon .
Forcing herself to assume a composure she was far from feeling , Gina allowed him to usher her from the small lobby behind the front door into a living-room of graceful proportions .
A guard ushered them into the Beauchamp Tower and up into Mistress Philippa 's chamber on the second floor .
Lydia watched Betty ushering the guests into the cottage .
His cheerful rubicund face was graver than usual , and when she had ushered him into the dining-room he began without preliminary :
Penry ushered her into the kitchen , unzipping her jacket as though she were a child .
Tweed ushered his guests to chairs , then sat back , leaving the field clear for Newman .
` You must have wondered if I had forgotten you , " were Poskonov 's opening words as he ushered Romanov to the comfortable chair .
When the cab came , Peter ushered Kate to the road and opened the door for her .
William Day stated that he had made towards the shadow , but Tidbury had barred his way and ushered him towards home .
He ushered them towards the car .
As Stephen ushered his guests across the cobbled yard and into the drive which led to the house , George glanced back .
He ushers her out of the restaurant saying : ` I think we should leave before the paparazzi get here . "
Julia ushered her out of the bedroom , afraid the sound of conflict might reach her mother .
Jakki was ushered into the star trailer .
Joan was ushered into the king 's private chamber by a manservant who had been with him since infancy .
After the tour we are ushered into the board-room where a magnificent buffet lunch is laid out .
Eventually the by now substantial crowds are ushered along the walls towards the square by the barely adolescent soldiers , some of whom ask for cigarettes as they do so .
She ushered the girl inside and sent her to the bathroom .
Dubois asked slowly as the Doctor ushered him and Petion back out .
Sometimes tourists wandered in off Longacre and looked about the hall of this famous British institution before he ushered them out .
The men ushered their wives and girlfriends to safety and then trudged the last mile to the party .
Catherine doubtfully puckered her lips when she saw the bedraggled red-eyed woman he ushered into her hallway , but her good nature got the better of her when she saw how badly Ixora was shivering .
Long before Davidson was ushered out , he was perceived to have failed .
The girl and her family were ushered out through a judge 's exit before reporters were allowed into court .
Dr Herrmann produced a card , flashed it at the immigration officers and they were ushered through .
` Do n't worry , " said Greg Carey , who had returned from ushering out his fellow guest .
